availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born on November 18, 1829 in Kentucky. Worked as a Farmer in Richmond, Madison County, Kentucky. Commander of the Silver Creek Rangers in 1861, a militia regiment from Madison County. Enlisted in the Confederate Army as a private a Richmond, Kentucky on September 10, 1862. Served in Company F, 11th Kentucky Cavalry Regiment. Died on October 23, 1862 in Madison County, Kentucky.

bibl.p: Find A Grave, "Durrett White (November 18, 1829-October 23, 1862)," Memorial #: 34199970, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=34199970&ref=acom (accessed May 24, 2017); Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Subdivision 2, p. 4; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 1, p. 377. Stephen Douglas Lynn, Confederate Soldiers of Kentucky: A Roster of the Veterans, 1861 - 1865 (Lexington: Stephen Douglas Lynn, 2002), 361.
